english: drum; to beat; to rouse/encourage; to swell

etymology.description: semantic: 壴 ‘drum’ + 支 ‘hand holding drumstick’
etymology.interpretation: A drum combined with a hand wielding a stick sketches the act of striking, yielding the meanings ‘drum’ and ‘to beat.’ By extension it describes stirring up emotions or forces and the bulging, billowing sense of ‘to swell.’

examples.chinese: 我敲着大鼓(我敲著大鼓)。
examples.english: I am beating the big drum.

examples.chinese: 老师鼓励我们努力学习(老師鼓勵我們努力學習)。
examples.english: The teacher encourages us to study hard.

examples.chinese: 风鼓起了帆(風鼓起了帆)。
